text: In addition to the large Galilean moons, Jupiter is orbited by sixty three smaller moons, but only two of them, Amalthea and Thebe, have been imaged at sufficient resolution for surface features to become apparent. ==Amalthea== ===Craters=== Amalthean craters are named after characters in Greek mythology associated with Zeus and Amalthea. {| class="wikitable" ! Crater !! Named after |- | Gaea || Gaia |- | Pan || Pan |} ===Faculae=== Faculae on Amalthea are named after locations in Greek mythology associated with Zeus. {| class="wikitable" ! Facula !! Named after |- | Ida Facula || Mount Ida, Crete |- | Lyctos Facula || Lyctos, Crete |} ==Thebe== The only Theban named feature is Zethus Crater, named after Zethus, the husband of Thebe. ==External links== * USGS: Amalthea nomenclature * USGS: Thebe nomenclature *Smaller moons Jupiter's inner moons
title: List of geological features on Jupiter's inner moons
